Returns: the formatted header, in a buffer that must not be modified
getBuffer().Description: Obtains the buffer with the formatted header. The returned buffer MUST NOT be modified.

Returns: index of the first character of the header value in the buffer returned by @B_org#apache#http#FormattedHeader#getBuffer_E@.
getValuePos().Description: Obtains the start of the header value in the @B_org#apache#http#FormattedHeader#getBuffer_E@. By accessing the value in the buffer, creation of a temporary string can be avoided.

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit An HTTP header which is already formatted. For example when headers are received, the original formatting can be preserved. This allows for the header to be sent without another formatting step.
